stories.text:
Heroku's router seems to be logging intermittent H10 "App Crash" errors, but the apps are not crashed. I've been seeing the sporatic behavior for about 16 hours.

An SO user reported the same [0], and it seems others are effected [1] [2]. Heroku has not communicated an outage.

Anybody know what's going on?

[0]: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/68764077/heroku-h10-error-but-web-dynos-are-not-crashing

[1]: https://twitter.com/jaredbrown/status/1426164985550475264

[2]: https://twitter.com/Gemfury/status/1426154622645768192
stories.title: Ask HN: Is Heroku Having an Outage?

stories.text:
If your production website uses HTTPS, you want your local development site to behave like an HTTPS site.
With the new module for Devserver, it is possible to automatically create virtual hosts and certificates and then run a local development site with HTTPS. Virtual Hosts Manager : https://warehouse.easyphp.org/inventory-devserver#devtools. It needs Apache 2.4.48.
stories.title: HTTPS for Local PHP Developement
